summary: This document is a deposition of Ghislaine Maxwell, conducted as part of a civil lawsuit involving plaintiffs Sheldon Barr and Thomas Gardner against the City of New York and 116 East 65th Street, LLC. Maxwell discusses her ownership of the property at 116 East 65th Street, her residency, and her business activities related to Ellmax, LLC. This deposition features Ghislaine Maxwell discussing the formation and ownership of 116 East 65th Street, LLC, including details about its creation, members, and the property it owns. Maxwell provides information about her connections to Jeffrey Epstein and Darren Indyke, as well as her personal living arrangements and responsibilities related to the property. This deposition features Ghislaine Maxwell discussing the layout and use of her former residence at 116 East 65th Street, New York. She provides details about the office space within the house, her business activities, and the Terramar Project, including tax returns and personnel involved. The document highlights her claims regarding the use of the property and her business operations. This deposition features Ghislaine Maxwell discussing her business activities related to Ellmax and the Terramar Project, as well as her residence at 116 East 65th Street. Maxwell clarifies that her home was primarily a residence and not used for business purposes, and she did not receive any salary or remuneration from the Terramar Project. This document appears to be a court filing related to the Epstein case, containing various references to individuals, events, and legal proceedings. It includes mentions of evidence, examination details, and procedural aspects of the case. This document appears to be a deposition transcript related to the Epstein case, containing various references to testimony and corrections made by witnesses. It includes a correction/errata sheet indicating changes to the testimony provided during the deposition.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was the owner of the property at 116 East 65th Street in New York.
Maxwell stated that she lived at 116 East 65th Street as her primary residence back in September 2015.
She has dual citizenship in France and England, and became a U.S. citizen in the late '90s.
Maxwell was the sole member of Ellmax, LLC., a company she formed to advise businesses.
The deposition took place on April 9, 2019, as part of a civil lawsuit involving claims against the City of New York.
Ghislaine Maxwell is the sole member of 116 East 65th Street, LLC.
Darren Indyke was referred to Maxwell by Jeffrey Epstein.
Maxwell's housekeeper, Maritsa, worked for her five days a week.
116 East 65th Street, LLC was formed in 2000 and purchased the property for around $6,000,000.
Maxwell does not recall specific details about the formation and purchase timing of the LLC.
Ghislaine Maxwell confirmed that the office in her residence was used for personal and business purposes.
The Terramar Project was formed around 2011 or 2012, with Maxwell as its president.
Maxwell stated that she did not conduct business out of her residence at 116 East 65th Street.
The residence was sold on April 14, 2016, for approximately $15.05 million.
Maxwell mentioned that there were no salaried employees for the Terramar Project, only officers who did not receive payment.
Ghislaine Maxwell stated that her home at 116 East 65th Street was primarily a residence and not used for business purposes.
Maxwell confirmed that she did not receive any salary or remuneration from the Terramar Project.
Ellmax, LLC was dormant after 2013 and did not generate revenue during that time.
Maxwell indicated that she did not entertain clients or conduct business meetings at her home between 2010 and 2013.
The property at 116 East 65th Street was used as an address of convenience for both Ellmax and the Terramar Project.
The document is a court filing dated March 5, 2020.
Ghislaine Maxwell is extensively mentioned, indicating her significant role in the case.
Jeffrey Epstein is also referenced, highlighting ongoing legal matters related to him.
The document is a deposition transcript dated March 5, 2020.
It includes a correction/errata sheet for testimony given during the deposition.
No named individuals are mentioned in the provided text.
